hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric ETH/BTC Reaction to Negative Bitcoin-Specific News
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL/BEAR regimes, negative Bitcoin-specific news (e.g., miner selling, ETF outflows) will cause BTC to underperform ETH by 0.8-1.5% over the following 12 hours, as capital rotates into the perceived 'next best' asset.
hypothesis_content.rationale: During risk-off periods with Bitcoin-specific catalysts, traders may rotate rather than exit crypto entirely. ETH often benefits as the largest altcoin. This is a relative value play within the asset class.
entry_conditions: Bitcoin-specific negative news headline (miners, ETFs, hashrate, governance)
ETH/BTC ratio 1-hour change is positive (ETH outperforming)

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH/BTC ratio increases by +0.9% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio decreases by -0.4% from entry (BTC outperforms)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETH/BTC ratio shows no consistent outperformance (median change <0.2%) following Bitcoin-negative news, or BTC consistently outperforms in these scenarios.
